metadata.title: CVE-2023-1393 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in X.Org Server Overlay Window. A Use-After-Free may lead to local privilege escalation. If a client explicitly destroys the compositor overlay window (aka COW), the Xserver would leave a dangling pointer to that window in the CompScreen structure, which will trigger a use-after-free later.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1393` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

xnest - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7
xorg-server-source - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7
xserver-common - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7
xserver-xephyr - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7
xserver-xorg-core - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7
xvfb - 2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7
No subscription required

xwayland - 2:22.1.3-2ubuntu0.4
No subscription required

notes.note: mdeslaur> xorg server is actually the xorg-server package the xorg package only contains docs xwayland package contains parts of xorg-server  This is ZDI-CAN-19866

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:21.1.4-2ubuntu1.7').
xwayland package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:22.1.3-2ubuntu0.4').
